list_definition.definition: flowers, especially of a fruit tree

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She blossomed into a beautiful woman.

list_ex_of_english: What was once the scraggly effort of a few odd individuals has now blossomed into a major field.
Cultural arguments have always been considered an important explanatory variable in the development literature that blossomed since the 1960s.
The focus of chemical-pharmaceutical practice was the extraction of aqueous and oily distillates from vegetable materials such as spices, herbs, blossoms, fruits, seeds, woods, husks, and barks.
You moved on exactly when this was blossoming.
He blossomed again, found work, became a very good officer worker earning a high salary.
Following almost every privatisation, we have seen boardroom share options blossoming and people ripping off public funds like there was no tomorrow.
The same children have blossomed in the special school environment.
The thought blossomed like a magician's bouquet.
